creditline: Gift of funds from Mrs. Lynden F. King
description: Elizabethan: framework unornamented; four panels on back, four panels on lid, and two each on sides, plain; four panels on front ornamented with "linenfold" carving. Original lock, hinges affixed later.
text: Storage chests were one of the earliest and most common forms of household furniture. The panels and frame are hewn from solid oak. The carving on the panels is known as "linen-fold" ornament, a popular motif from the Gothic era which persisted well into the reign of Queen Elizabeth I.
title: Chest
